content: The Justice Department asked a federal judge on Monday for an emergency stay that would put on hold his decision that temporarily blocked President Obama’s executive actions on immigration, saying the decision threatens national security. The Department of Homeland Security will sustain “irreparable harm” if a stay is not granted, the Justice Department said. The judge, Andrew Hanen of United States District Court for the Southern District of Texas, last week halted the immigration actions, which would grant temporary relief from deportation for 4.7 million people who are in the United States illegally. Officials also appealed Monday to the United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit, in New Orleans.
title: U.S. Asks Judge to Lift His Block on Obama’s Immigration Actions
